data.text:
Boarding schools in New York are a great option for students and parents who are looking for the best education possible. There are many prestigious boarding schools in New York, but not all of them are created equally. If you want to enroll your child in a boarding school in New York state, this post will give you some insight into what you should be looking for.

Choosing the best boarding schools in New York might not be as easy as you think. There are a lot of different factors to consider, including location, cost, type of school, and accreditation. Boarding schools are popular among parents who want their children to have a better education than public schools can offer. This is because students often have more opportunities for one-on-one attention from teachers and more chances for academic success as compared to those at public schools. To find the best boarding schools in New York for your child, read on below:

Best Boarding Schools in New York

The Best Boarding School Ranking in this post is according to Niche Ranking, and it is based on rigorous analysis of key statistics and millions of reviews from students and parents.

It bases ranking on SAT/ACT scores, the quality of colleges that students consider, student-teacher ratio, boarding school ratings, amongst other factors.

Here is a list of the Best Boarding Schools in New York:

#1. Hackley School

Hackley School, a top-rated, private boarding school is in Tarrytown, NY. And, it has 834 students in grades K-12 with a student-teacher ratio of 8 to 1. Also, according to Niche, Hackley School Ranking is:

best Boarding High School in New York (1st out of 26)

8th best Private K-12 School in New York

9th best Private High School in New York

Furthermore, Hackley School Yearly tuition is $45,775 for the highest grade. After graduation, all the students from this school attend a 4-year college.

The acceptance rate for the Hackley School is 27%.

Hackley School Website

Emma Willard School is in Troy, New York. It encourages all young women to enjoy learning, the habits of intellectual life, and the character, moral strength, and leadership qualities needed to serve and shape their world.

Additionally, according to Niche, Emma Willard School ranking is:

6th best all-girls high School in New York

20th best Private High School in New York

Emma Willard School Yearly tuition is $37,690 for the highest grade. Also, the Emma Willard School acceptance rate is 36%.
